Detailed Description

Renderers are responsible for drawing a single cell within an owner drawn ObjectListView.

Methods on this class are called during the DrawSubItem event.

Subclasses will normally override the Render method, and use the other methods as helper functions.

Image BrightIdeasSoftware.BaseRenderer.GetImage (  ) 

Return the image that should be drawn against this subitem.

Returns:
An Image or null if no image should be drawn.

Definition at line 2326 of file ObjectListView.cs.

Image BrightIdeasSoftware.BaseRenderer.GetImage ( Object  imageSelector  ) 

Return the actual image that should be drawn when keyed by the given image selector. An image selector can be:

  • an int, giving the index into the image list
  • a string, giving the image key into the image list
  • an Image, being the image itself

.

Parameters:
imageSelector The value that indicates the image to be used
Returns:
An Image or null

Parameters:

g The context that our drawing should be done using

Definition at line 2299 of file ObjectListView.cs.

bool BrightIdeasSoftware.BaseRenderer.DoubleBuffered [get]

Is this renderer drawing into a graphics double buffer?

.NET 2.0 has bugs in its handling of double buffered graphics, so we sometimes need to behave differently if we are drawing into a buffered graphics context.
